meanings.definition: In a manner that is easily excited or aroused.
meanings.sent1: The puppy wagged its tail excitably when it saw its favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: She always talks excitably when discussing her favorite book series.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled excitably as they waited for the magician to perform his tricks.
meanings.sent4: The colorful balloons floated excitably in the sky during the festive parade.
meanings.sent5: The students listened excitably as the teacher announced a surprise field trip.

meanings.definition: In a way that shows a tendency to become excited quickly.
meanings.sent1: The little girl clapped excitably when she saw the ice cream truck approaching.
meanings.sent2: He always answers questions excitably during class discussions.
meanings.sent3: The fans cheered excitably as their favorite team scored a goal.
meanings.sent4: The leaves rustled excitably in the wind on the first day of autumn.
meanings.sent5: The children ran excitably to the playground when the bell rang for recess.
